Not violent, but slow, passionate, dreamlike. They are completely enjoying each other. The satisfaction seems spiritual. They stare into each other's eyes the entire time. They are lost. Gradually Victor's rhythm builds. As his momentum increases, as the ecstasy nears, Cynthia accelerates too. Heaving, gasping, they are approaching a beautiful climax. But just when it seems Victor is on the verge, the very threshold, he stops and JUMPS violently out of bed.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Connie, I don't know about your previous lives, but in this one, you're a shithead. She follows Cynthia. 88B   INT. CYNTHIA'S ROOM - DAY                                        88B Cynthia is on the bad, crying. Miriam comes in, sits beside her... Cynthia jumps at the weight on the bad, calms when she sees who it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, you can't blame yourself. Lana was an unhappy girl. Sometimes unhappy girls do foolish things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't kill herself. Cynthia sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was Harris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harris? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Unity House. He comes to me, Miriam. He talks to me. He reminds me that I was supposed to go with them that night--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go with them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the fire. To the next world. They waited while I was in a coma... He told me that if I didn't join him, he would take someone also... and he did it, Miriam, he did it! Miriam gets up, her face a mixture of sympathy... sympathy and something else. She lights a cigarette. Involuntarily, Cynthia FLINCHES at the spark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You...   you don't believe me, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe that you believe it. And I also believe that shooting you up every time you get the heebie- jeebies ain't gonna do shit for your real problems. We gotta get you out of here--get you to some nice place at the beach or the mountains where you can fight your demons in your own way. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't know anyone.   I don't have any money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (skeptical) And you have money, right? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) 88C   CLOSE ON MIRIAM                                                88C MIRIAM Look. Despite popular opinion to the contrary, I have not always been the career borderline psychotic neurotic that I am today. Up until a coupla years ago I was a writer, a reporter, a damn good one too... Hell, I really kicked some ass with that Selectric... She seems lost in thought for a moment. Unconsciously, she scratches her wrist... a wrist where we notice for the first time a PURPLE SCAR across the veins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was on the staff of a magazine... Well, some people called it a rag, but it was home: ME! Magazine. You heard of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in a coma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, right. Well, when they took me off to the funny farm, Saul--he's the editor--he said I was always welcome back. Maybe this is the time. See, if I can go to him, tell him your story, I could get a big advance... I'd share it with you, and we'd be set! I mean, girl, your story has everything... death, hospitalization, weird rituals, maybe a little romance-- I've seen all those longing glances between you and Goldman-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and now with poor Lana we got a little mystery. Hell, you're not an article, you're a goddamned mini- series! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...   I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia, let me be honest. This is a great story, and it means a second chance for me, so, okay, there's some self interest here. But I really think you need to tell people about Unity House... about the way decent ideas and dreams got twisted into something sick and poisonous. You owe it to the world. You owe it to yourself. It's your life, and you have to ask yourself how you want to live it... (sharper) --if you want to live it. Cynthia turns, mind made up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I know a way to make a phone call. We'll have you out of here tonight. Miriam suddenly stops, almost paralyzed with anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia.    This is the right thing to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh oh.     Mum's the word. Alan is coming down the hallway towards them.   They move towards the elevator. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding) Ladies. Good to see you socializing, Cynthia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (to Miriam) See you later. And...     thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Miriam then gets into the elevator.         The doors remain open, Alan turns to Cynthia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. He heads off in the opposite direction. Cynthia watches him. She turns back towards Miriam. Miriam is alone in the elevator except for one other person. Miriam smiles and waves. Cynthia smiles and waves. From behind Miriam, Harris, all burned and puffy, smiles and waves. The elevator doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Alan whirls around.       Cynthia rushes to the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miriam!    Stop! She bangs on the buttons. She pounds on the doors.          Everyone in the corridor turns to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) He starts to approach.   She runs to a stairwell. 93   INT. STAIRWELL                                                      93 Cynthia sprints down a flight.    She goes out onto 94   INT. HALLWAY, ONE FLIGHT DOWN                                       94 Cynthia runs to the elevator and pounds on the button, but the elevator car has already passed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling into the door) Miriam, get out! She races back to 95   INT. STAIRWELL                                                      95 She flies down the steps.    We can hear ALAN tailing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia! She swings around a turn into a flight and trips.     Suddenly she's ROLLING DOWN A 96   EXT. HILLSIDE - NIGHT                                               96 She SLAMS into a tree.   We see the Unity House in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's trying to get away! There are PEOPLE pounding through the brush all around her. She gets up and runs along the path into the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia! We want you to stay with us! You mustn't be afraid! She is in total panic, running blindly. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, no. Branches thrash her face. She can barely see where she is going, but she comes to a halt when she reaches a dark precipice, a cliff which seemingly has no bottom--just black as night. The people are getting nearer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's over here. We see someone nearing through the brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No pain, Cynthia. There's no pain. Come with us. Share with us. Take my hand. Cynthia looks down the cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my hand. Cynthia backs away. She starts lowering herself down, trying to get footing. Some rocks slide out. 97   INT. STAIRWELL                                                  97 ORDERLY Cynthia, take my hand. The Orderly rushes to her, but she wavers dizzily and FALLS down the half-flight. She's dazed, but she becomes alert when she sees the orderly approaching. She picks herself up and runs. 98   INT. TENTH FLOOR CORRIDOR                                       98 She gets to the elevator. The door is just closing, but it opens again against a purse--Miriam's purse. The elevator is empty. Cynthia whips around looking for her. Orderlies and nurses are moving towards her. At the opposite and of the hallway, a window is broken. Cynthia runs to it. There is a WOMAN'S SCREAM from the street below. PEOPLE YELLING. Cynthia looks out and down. We know what she sees.    She covers her face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: An orderly takes hold of her. She is docile now, almost weak. Alan runs up. He looks out the window. So does a Nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. The nurse crosses herself.    Cynthia is escorted away amid the confusion. 99    EXT. SKY - DAY                                                           99 The CAMERA IS MOVING FORWARD, TOWARDS the window. It seemingly goes OUT THROUGH THE WINDOW. The FRAME is filled with bright blue sky. Silence, except for a slight BREEZE. Someone is falling through the sky.       It is MIRIAM. We see her CLOSER, flowing down, the wind rushing up round her. She is happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia, it's really quite beautiful. The ground comes rushing up and we SLAM into it. BLACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 99A   INT. THERAPY ROOM - NIGHT                                               99A It's not a session.    It's a wake.   Cynthia sits, face half in shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They want us all now. They want us with them. Whether we like it or not, we're going,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia, we're all upset by what's happened. But let's not get-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harris promised us eternal bliss on the other side when we're all together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eternal bliss....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eternal bullshit--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miriam was going to write a story about me. He killed her because she was going to help me got out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not listening to me! He wants us all to die! He wants you all with them, and it's because of me! (sobbing) It's all because of me... Berrisford addresses a pack of about thirty REPORTERS and PHOTOGRAPHERS and CAMERAMEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Berrisford, what would you call two suicides on your promises so close together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd call it a tragic coincidence. Unfortunately, Borderline Personality Disorder is indicative of a pre-existing disposition towards suicidal tendencies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the commune girl? Has she confirmed that the fire was some sort of mass suicide?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As that is a police matter, I am not at liberty to comment on it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speaking of the police, doctor, isn't it true that they suspect that the recent deaths may not have been suicides at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's completely absurd.   Where do you get this nonsense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Lieutenant Wasserman. He confirmed to me that he's assigning some of his officers to the hospital grounds until further notice. Pandemonium as the other reporters seize this information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Berrisford, are you cooperating with the police? Dr. Berrisford, do your patients have a history of violence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... I have work to do.    No further questions. And--flustered for once--he leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is raining.   Cynthia sits in bed, in the dark. We see the CHARRED AND BURNED HARRIS sitting across the room in a shadow. Cynthia looks over at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in pain, Cynthia. He reaches up to his face, and peels off some skin.    It CRACKLES and oozes. He peels off more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your pain is my pain. We share it all, because we have our love. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . 92   INT. HALLWAY - DAY                                                 92 Cynthia walks along with Miriam towards the banks of elevators.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Our love will never die. Don't make me take another of your friends. Keep your promise, lovechild. Join me. She stands, fumbles for the switch, knocks over a glass, and turns on the light. He is gone. As she stands there in shock, a HAND touches her shoulder, spins her around. She GASPS-- It's Alan, who's just opened the door.        He looks at her, worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want you to be alone. She sways, dizzy, sags in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like I was right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 108   INT. CONNIE'S ROOM - NIGHT                                             108 Connie is sitting on her bad. She takes her pills from Hettie dutifully. Ed comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know me at feeding time. He takes his meds from her, smiling. CHEWS THEM loudly and sloppily until she grimaces and goes out. Then, the minute the door closes, Ed and Connie are in each other's arms. They kiss like characters in a Harlequin Romance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me before that you were a Prince of Ancient Atlantis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It slipped my mind ...    your Highness. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She kisses him passionately again.    He breaks the clinch, pulls her towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan site on the counter across from Cynthia's bed.    He plays with the hinged mirror on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he toys with the mirror, we see a CANTED REFLECTION of first Cynthia and then the hallway. A nurse passes by. 109A   ON CYNTHIA                                                        109A As she listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something catches her eye. 109B   IN THE MIRROR                                                     109B Connie and Ed walk by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia GASPS.    HARRIS HAS APPEARED IN THE MIRROR, following Ed and Connie. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: 109C   BACK TO SCENE                                                      109C Cynthia jumps up, heads for the door.    Alan catches her by the wrist,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan SLAPS her.    She pales... tries to hit him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands on rocky feet, unsure... 112    INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                               112 Connie and Ed come to a door marked "Utility." Ed looks around cautiously and opens the door, relieved that it's still unlocked. 113    INT. UTILITY ROOM - NIGHT                                          113 Once inside the small space, he kisses Connie. He pulls out a pint flask of schnapps from his bathrobe pocket. He gives her a swig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads her back to a door that's labeled "DANGER: Authorized Personnel Only." The lock is busted open.     They go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   INT. TURBINE ROOM - NIGHT                                        114 There are metal grating steps leading up to a platform that sits adjacent to a huge spinning turbine, its six-foot blades WHIRRING at top speed. Air ducts lead in and out of the space. Connie is uplifted, frightened, exhilarated. Their clothes and hair are blown around. They ascend the platform, and sit across from each other. They each take a swig. They kiss softly, spiritually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so happy. 115   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                             115 The door to the utility room CLOSES.   It LOCKS. 116   INT. TURBINE ROOM - NIGHT                                        116 Connie and Ed stare into each other's eyes.   They are lost. The CAMERA MOVES IN AND OUT between and around them, exploring the depth of their absorption. The CAMERA MOVES TOWARDS the huge spinning turbine. Its SOUND builds to a tremendous ROAR. We see Connie and Ed through the door into the turbine room. The door is pulled closed by someone or something. The knob locks. 117   INT. CYNTHIA'S ROOM - NIGHT                                      117 Cynthia keeps looking at the door, worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miriam and Lana were both deeply disturbed women. Miriam tried to kill herself before. Lana was obsessed with the morbid... You heard her in the sessions. You can't twist what they did into something other than what it was. Just then, all the lights go OUT. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what? In the darkness, he stumbles towards the light, flicks it. Nothing. The door OPENS. In the dim light of the hallway emergency lamps, we SEE Cynthia go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it, Cynthia, come back--! Trying to follow, he COLLIDES With some furniture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit--! 118   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                            118 Darkness and confusion. Cynthia passes by the CAMERA. A moment later Alan comes by, looking for her. Other patients come out and wonder. Flashlights. A NURSE streams by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just overloaded circuits. Everyone, please go back into your room. CAMERA ADJUSTS to show an elderly, skeletal custodian, EDGAR, on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The turbine room upstairs? All right. (he hangs up) We'll set it straight in a minute. Somethin's caught in the turbine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry. 120   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                            120 Edgar comes up to the utility door, but it won't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit. He walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 121    INT. UTILITY TUNNEL - NIGHT                                           121 This is a low passageway between floors. Edgar has to stoop under the ducts and pipes. He comes to a small hatchway in the coiling above him marked "CAUTION: Turbine." There is a latch which has to be pulled to release the hatchway. Edgar pulls. It's stuck. He yanks with his frail body. The latch barely moves. A TRICKLE OF BLOOD streams out at the edge, but Edgar doesn't see it. Edgar yanks and pulls with all his might, groaning and heaving. Finally he stops in frustration. He sits an a duct, resting. Just then the latch undoes itself. The hatchway slams open. Edgar is showered with red lumpy fluid. He is coated with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? Edgar looks down. In the pool of red is a woman's shoe. Puzzled, he bends down, picks it up. Something FALLS OUT OF IT. 121A   ON THE FLOOR                                                        121A It is a SEVERED HUMAN FOOT. 121B   ON EDGAR                                                            121B as he reacts in shock, the spinning turbine begins to SPLATTER DROPS OF BLOOD on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 122    INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                                  122 Cynthia comes towards us.       Alan, further down the hall, sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia--! Cynthia turns, reacts...       and then reacts to-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes into another corridor. Alan hurries to catch up, but then has to help a nurse with a frightened OLDER WOMAN. 122A   ANOTHER CORRIDOR - WITH CYNTHIA                                      122A CONNIE'S VOICE Cynthia. Cynthia moves down the hall a bit.       She looks up at the coiling. 123    ANGLE - THE AIR VENT                                                 123 CONNIE'S VOICE (CONT'D) Cynthia, we're up here! Down the hall further, another vent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cynthia follows the voices. She is underneath another larger vent with a fan spinning inside. Everyone in the hall ignores her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Harris now, behind the fan, in brief flashes of light, burnt then normal, gazing down at Cynthia. He reaches towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His fingers ARE SLICED OFF BY THE FAN.       He takes no notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) We hear SPLASHING. Cynthia looks over. Gallons of blood and solid matter pour out of the ceiling vents all down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are they? (she is frantic) Where are Connie and Ed?   Where are they? Alan wonders at the pouring red, then he hears Cynthia screaming. He runs down the hall to stop her. The patients and nurses watch the blood pour in horror. Cynthia is getting more and more hysterical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are Connie and Ed? Alan corners her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right--it's all right-- Suddenly, out of nowhere, a BL00D-COVERED BODY careens into them, driving them apart! 123A   ANGLE                                                           123A It's Edgar, covered with blood, in a total state of shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --horrible--sweet Jesus--help me-- Alan struggles to restrain him.   Nurses run to help. 123B   CYNTHIA                                                         123B Huddles on the floor in a position not unlike the one from her coma. She SOBS uncontrollably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan and an orderly escort Cynthia to her room. Alan comes out, watches Edgar pass by in a wheelchair, raving. Ralph and Gilda come up to Alan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is going on? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Ed and Connie.    They're dead, aren't they? Alan looks at her.       How did the grapevine got it to her so fast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. We're not sure what happened... There was evidence that they were drinking... They fell into... the main turbine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck... Look, Ed drank before. Lots of times. Didn't know that, did you? But he didn't usually decide to jump into a mix master, man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ralph, as for your own safety, you are being given the most amount of protection possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police are powerless.    Ask Cynthia. She knows. (softly) Harris wants us all. Ralph looks at Gilda with almost as much dismay as Alan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Fucking Christ!    I'm getting the hell out of here. Ralph storms out. 125   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                                 125 As Ralph moves along, a paunchy POLICEMAN intercepts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant Wasserman assigned me to you. Where you go-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get the picture. Try not to shoot me or your fat ass, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The newscast continues silently on the TV in her room.    She is getting dressed. She peaks out the door. 128   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                               128 The Policeman assigned to her is down the hall a ways, chatting with a nurse. Cynthia slips out and down the corridor. She waits for an elevator. When a door opens, she tries to inconspicuously slip inside but she finds herself face to face with Alan who in just getting out of the elevator. He holds a grocery bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this a coincidence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting out of here. He takes her arm and starts leading her back to her room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe it or not, this is the safest place for you to be. The police are here. There are doctors here. And I'm going to keep you company, all night. I even brought provisions. He shows a variety of fast food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pure unadulterated junk. At this point, who cares about the chemicals? She smiles slightly. He holds his arm out for her like a swain escorting his date. She takes it in a similar spirit. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The policeman comes out of Cynthia's room, looking for her in alarm. He's instantly relieved to see her there with Alan. Alan directs her inside. She goes. Alan gives the Policeman a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes into her room, leaving the embarrassed cop behind. Suddenly the LIGHTS RETURN with an eye-jarring FLASH. The cop has his revolver halfway out of the holster before he realizes what it is. 128B   INT. CYNTHIA'S ROOM - NIGHT                                       128B They both react   to the returned power with relief. Alan takes the stuff   out of the bag: chips, dips, cookies, six- packs of beer.    He offers some of the chips. She shakes her head. The TV's    still on. Alan switches channels with the sound muted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pointing upwards. An outstretched hand SLAMS itself down, the blade impaling through the palm. The hand squirms its fingers a bit, then pulls off. 130    INT. RALPH'S ROOM - NIGHT                                           130 He gets up clenching the perforated hand. He is very calm. He closes the knife and puts it in a drawer. Suddenly, violently, he kicks a trash bin.      Then he is calm again. Ralph's assigned Policeman pokes his head in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Ralph sticks his hand behind him.       He is very friendly, very normal. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thank you, officer. Hey, lemme buy you a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds good to me. 131   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                                 131 Ralph comes out of his room. Ralph's policeman is beside him. His hand bleeds, but goes unnoticed. 132   INT. CYNTHIA'S ROOM - NIGHT                                          132 Alan lies back in front of the TV, eyes closed, SNORING. Sympathetic, Cynthia slips the remote control from his hand... then there is a KNOCK at the door. She goes there, finds Ralph, who steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a sec.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ralph? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I just came to tell you-- (smiling, conspiratorially) Everything's gonna be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to be okay? He goes into the bathroom and rinses his blood-soaked hand. Cynthia sees this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Everything's gonna be okay. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ralph? Cynthia is mystified.    He goes. 133   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                                133 Ralph walks off, his Policeman following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ralph? 134   INT. CYNTHIA'S ROOM - NIGHT                                         134 She comes in and pokes Alan awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ralph was just here.   His hand was... all bloody. They go to the door and they are immediately faced with Hettie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Goldman, have you seen Ralph?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to ask you the same thing. She holds up a paper cup with a tablet in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't take his four o'clock. If he misses this one, I'm gonna... Alan takes the capsule, examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! It's his tranquilizer! If he doesn't take this, he'll completely flip out--! Alan and Cynthia run down the hall.     Cynthia's policeman follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 135   INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT                                                  135 Alan and Cynthia and the policeman scan for Ralph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. 136   ANGLE - ON THE FLOOR                                                  136 Every five or six feet along in a line, there is a moderately- sized droplet splatter of blood.
